name: Dinner Tonight: Egg Drop Soup
description: How should egg drop soup taste to someone who regularly makes trips down to Chinatown? This recipe from is far more refined than the gloppy renditions I'm used to, plus it's really simple.
recipeIngredient: ¾ cup shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded, thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Crack eggs into medium-sized bowl and whisk lightly. Rinse off whisk. Pour ½ cup of stock into another medium-sized bowl and add cornstarch. Whisk until cornstarch is dissolved.

Pour remaining stock into medium-sized saucepan along with ginger, soy sauce, scallions, mushrooms, and black pepper. Turn heat to high and bring to boil. Slowly drizzle in cornstarch mixture, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to medium-low and bring soup to simmer.
Slowly drizzle in eggs, stirring lazily with a fork. Egg should immediately turn into ribbons. Once added, turn off the heat. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
